comments:
Using the May 2 driver, the Profile launch configuration does not show the launch config analysis types. The launcher config stalls with a "Pending" check box in the launch config.

The virtual machine is Sun 15011

I don't actually see the problem with 4.4.0-200705021157 build using SUN 1.5_11 build

Assign to Ali for further analysis.

Guru, does the problem happen with other JVM?
I have not tested with other VM's.

Created an attachment (id=65845)
screen shot of using JVM SUN 1.5 _11

Created an attachment (id=65846)
screen shot of TI analysis type showing in launch configuration

Irregardless of what I do, I'm not able to reproduce this defect.  Here are the different permutations that I have tested with:

IAC with Sun-SDK-1.5.0_11
IAC with Sun-SDK-1.4.2_13
IAC with IBM-SDK-1.5

AC on command prompt with Sun-SDK-1.5.0_11
AC on command prompt with Sun-SDK-1.4.2_13
AC on command prompt with IBM-SDK-1.5

I also have code in trace.ui to cause a time-out after 10 seconds.  The maximum time for the monitor tree not to be populated should not exceed 30 seconds (I have tested this as well).  Normally the tree should get populated within 5 seconds if IAC is starting the Agent Controller or 1-2 seconds if AC has manually been started.

If both PI and the TI data collectors are appearing, then the client is not able to establish a connection with your Agent Controller.  Please make sure that your firewall is configured properly and that you're not selecting "Local Direct Connection" under the host tab.

I'm marking this as works for me but if you're able to consistently reproduce this, then let's work together to determine what is different between our machines.

I'm able to reproduce this error and it's being caused by the execution framework throwing this exception:

Exception in thread "org.eclipse.hyades.execution.core.task.ReusableThread@40804080" java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.local.util.AgentControllerDescriptor.versionIsAtLeast(AgentControllerDescriptor.java:67)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.local.util.AgentControllerDescriptor.isVersionAtLeast(AgentControllerDescriptor.java:194)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.local.file.FileManagerFactory$3.run(FileManagerFactory.java:413)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.core.task.ReusableThread.run(ReusableThread.java:131)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:797)


Guru, please put a breakpoint on line #496 of PIDelegateHelper (process.launch()) and notice how after you step over this line the above exception is repeatedly produced.
This is happening on my hyper-threaded desktop machine using IBM JDK1.5 and Sun 1.4.2_10
After restarting my Eclipse workbench and re-generating IAC's config files, I was able to make this work.  I'm no longer getting the exceptions.

This exception is caused when the configuration file for the execution framework is not generated.  Unfortunatly the Agent Controller is started even when this configuration file is not generated, which leads to the exception Ali has noted.  If the Agent Controller detected this problem and prevented from starting then we wouldn't have this problem.  There is another defect open to add in a config validator in IAC so that it wouldn't start up when this configuration file hasn't been generated properly.  This defect is really a duplicate of bug 184039.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 184039 ***
